You can make a year-end tax deductible donation, or even better, you can become a partner in possibility by becoming a monthly donor. Sumithra, who is fondly known by her friends as “Sumi” in the Rockville adult program, is often very reserved and may come across as shy. Once music starts to play and she hears a song she enjoys, something switches and “reserved Sumi” becomes “spirited Sumi!” During dancercise, which is a time the individuals participate in exercise through dance, Sumi can be found in the program space flipping her hair, grooving to music with a playful smile, and beckoning her peers to join in on the fun.

Despite her seemingly shy demeanor, Sumi is a phenomenal cheerleader, full of rambunctious energy. In May, Sumi joined her team in representing the US at the 2019 World Cheerleading Championship in Disney World. Her team won a trophy and gold medals, and upon their return to Maryland they were invited by WTOP News & Montgomery Community Media to share their story!

Sumi is loved by her peers and staff in Rockville, and we are so proud of her great achievement!

Remembering Joseph “J” Watkins

When those of us at St. Coletta think of our friend and board member, “J”, we remember his generosity of spirit and his willingness to do anything to help with our mission. But most of all when we think of him the word that comes to mind is magic. “J” was an enchanter. You were captivated in his presence by his mischievous grin and that glint in his eye. He was our own Puck always ready for a laugh and a good time. Being with him was special because he was special.

He had tremendous creative gifts that were enhanced by his ability to see beyond a vacant hotel ballroom into a world of make believe. Every year when we had our annual gala he amazed. His work with flowers and décor was so much an expression of who he was as a person, glad, unconventional, delightful. He had the ability to pull back the curtain of everyday and introduce you to moments of true wonder.
Flowers never last as long as you want them to and neither did he. Oh how he will be missed.

Sharon B. Raimo
CEO, St Coletta of Greater Washington
on behalf of the Board of Trustees and staff
